intro: Brasolia oliva-estevae, commonly known as the Olive-Esteva Brasolia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
